channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: The worst dressed stars of the 2021 Emmys
item.description: The red carpet for the 73rd Primetime Emmy Awards kicked off in Los Angeles on Sunday afternoon. These are DailyMail.com's picks for the worst dressed stars of the red carpet.

item.title: Volcano ERUPTS on Spanish island La Palma as rescuers scramble to evacuate 5,000 residents
item.description: The explosion took place in an area known as Cabeza de Vaca on the western slope of the volcano and comes after the island registered up to 1,000 earthquakes in the past five days.

item.title: Taxpayers face multibillion-pound bailout
item.description: The UK's biggest power firms will call on Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng to help Britons by removing the cost of green subsidies from payments.

item.title: DOMINIC LAWSON: Proof Remainers were wrong when they said we'd have no friends post-Brexit
item.description: DOMINIC LAWSON: No one does pique quite like the French. And this great nation's government has thrown a fit of pique over the Australia's decision to scrap its agreement to buy French submarines

item.title: Emma Corrin, Gillian Anderson and Olivia Colman attend Emmy Awards screening in London
item.description: Gillian Anderson, Olivia Colman, Emma Corrin, and Emerald Fennell wowed at an Emmy Celebration at the Soho House in London on Sunday.

item.title: Husband of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe tells Liz Truss his wife's case should be the 'top priority'
item.description: The husband of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, Richard Ratcliffe, told Liz Truss that his wife's case should be the top priority and he wanted to see the Government tackle hostage-taking head on.

item.title: Emma Corrin looks uncannily like The Handmaid's Tale with their pale yellow bonnet at Emmy Awards
item.description: Emma Corrin decided to channel another character on Sunday at the Emmy Awards screening in London - June Osborne from The Handmaid's Tale.

item.title: Police launch urgent kidnap probe
item.description: Detectives have launched an urgent investigation after a member of the public reported that they had seen a young girl screaming for help in a black Mercedes in Haringey, north London.

item.title: Four people are found dead in house in Derbyshire
item.description: Emergency teams were called to the property in Killamarsh, Derbyshire, at around 7.25am following concerns over the safety of those at the address.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: Red carpet stars return for night of glamor
item.description: Hollywood's biggest TV stars descended upon LA Live in downtown Los Angeles Sunday night to kick off the 73rd Annual Primetime Emmy Awards.

item.title: New homeowner is shocked to find a rag doll boarded up in a wall saying she killed a family
item.description: Jonathan Lewis, 32, had picked up the keys to his new home in Walton-on-the-Hill, Surrey, when he decided to examine the void underneath the stairs that had been boarded up.

item.title: Invitations for booster jabs will be sent to 1.5million people
item.description: Invitations urging Britons to arrange a third jab through the National Booking Service will be sent to 1.5million people in England today as the Government prepares to top-up immunity.

item.title: FBI say body 'matching the description' of Gabby Petito has been found in Wyoming
item.description: The FBI announced that they have discovered human remains consistent with the description of missing van-life girl Gabby Petito at a press conference Sunday afternoon.

item.title: 'We will be judged by history': Boris Johnson calls for action on climate change as he flies to US
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is set to hold talks in New York on Monday before heading to Washington for his first White House summit where he hopes to mend fences with Joe Biden

item.title: Are 226,000-year-old handprints oldest art... or just child's play?
item.description: Researchers said the prints, which were found in Tibet, were deliberately formed in a pattern. If they are seen as art, the prints are more than 100,000 years older than the earliest cave paintings.

item.title: Men with prostate cancer could be cured in ONE WEEK
item.description: Doctors at the London Royal Marsden hospital are this week set to treat the first patient as part of a trial looking into whether it is safe to give radiotherapy in two large doses instead of lots of smaller doses.

item.title: ANDREW PIERCE: The 'Trot fest' that threatens to break Keir Starmer
item.description: ANDREW PIERCE: Several figures embroiled in the party's anti-Semitism crisis will be at The World Transformed alternative conference held in the seaside resort at the same time as Labour's.

item.title: Sadiq Khan calls for face masks to be made compulsory on public transport
item.description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has said that ministers should make face masks on public transport compulsory again. He said the voluntary system in England is not working.

item.title: Chinese leader Xi Jinping 'not yet confirmed' as attending Cop 26 climate conference in Glasgow
item.description: Cop 26 president Alok Sharma was unable to confirm China would even be sending a delegation to the gathering in November - although he insisted he was 'very, very hopeful' they would.

item.title: 'Human swan' in horror crash: Paraglider seriously hurt in crash that kills colleague in record bid
item.description: Sacha Dench fell from the sky after colliding with Dan Burton, a member of her support crew who was in a separate paramotor and died after the mid-air crash in the Scottish Highlands this weekend.

item.title: Just 99 hero translators are saved from the Taliban: Slammed as 'pathetic' by campaigners
item.description: The Government has declined to say how many ex-translators who risked their lives beside UK troops were airlifted to safely in Operation Pitting.

item.title: Post Office trials deliveries by two specially designed vehicles in bid for eco-friendly rounds
item.description: About the size of a golf buggy, two specially designed vehicles will be assessed for six months delivering letters and small parcels in Edinburgh, Crewe, Liverpool, Swindon and London.

item.title: Koalas are going EXTINCT with as few as 30,000 left in the Australian wild
item.description: Scientists have issued a dramatic warning koalas could become extinct with just 30,000 left in the wild.

item.title: Romantic flyboarder stuns crowd with 007-style tricks... and a marriage proposal
item.description: Surging into the sky and swooping back down over the water in Dartmouth, Devon, flyboarder James Prestwood is everywhere you look around - just like the song.

item.title: Queen's Commonwealth Trust boss says appointing Naomi Campbell will keep the institution relevant
item.description: The model, 51, has been announced as The Queen's Commonwealth Trust Platinum Jubilee Global Ambassador, where she will be involved with championing the work of young leaders.

item.title: BBC producers hired SNP councillor and anti-nuclear campaigner to help make submarine drama Vigil
item.description: The series' producers hired Scottish National Party councillor Feargal Dalton, who opposes the Trident system, to act as a script consultant and to provide advice on nuclear submarines.

item.title: Pilot in critical condition after landing on powerline from military aircraft crash near Fort Worth
item.description: Two pilots were ejected from a military aircraft in a crash that damaged three homes in the Lake Worth, Texas area on Sunday and left one pilot critically injured and another in stable condition.

item.title: Prostate cancer drugs that halve risk of dying: New hope for patients thanks to new treatment
item.description: Around 10,000 men a year in the UK have an aggressive form of prostate cancer, which is treated with hormone therapy and radiotherapy. A new drug could halve death rates over six years.

item.title: After he fled to Russia, Kim Philby bombarded his wife Eleanor with letters begging her to join him
item.description: Facing exposure by MI6 and almost certainly the death penalty, Kim Philby had fled to Moscow - from where he wrote to his wife pleading for her to join him.

item.title: BETH HALE's tribute to Only Fools And Horses star John Challis following his death at 79
item.description: BETH HALE: John Challis was only supposed to be in one episode. But as in all the best comedy, sometimes you simply can't predict what, or in this case who, is going to be a hit.

item.title: Folic acid will be baked into bread to slash risk of birth defects in decision hailed as 'momentous'
item.description: The Government has decided folic acid will be added to both white and brown flour in a bid to reduce the risk of birth defects caused by folic acid deficiency by up to 20 per cent

item.title: JAN MOIR: Spray tans, sequins and a shimmying silver fox... it can only be Strictly, my loves
item.description: JAN MOIR: Welcome to the ballroom of broken dreams, to the terpsichorean colosseum throbbing with celebrity gladiators in their gladrags, preparing to do battle with the beat.

item.title: Brazilian legend Pele posts picture of him 'punching the air in celebration of every better day'
item.description: On Friday, the three-time World Cup winner was readmitted to hospital just three days after leaving having previously undergone an operation to remove a colon tumour.

item.title: 'Freedoms need to be defended': Liz Truss slaps down France in row over Aussie sub deal
item.description: She lashed out amid an astonishing diplomatic spat triggered by the Aukus deal, that will see the US and UK supply Canberra, replacing a deal to acquire French submarines.

item.title: Growing toll of illnesses missed by 'remote' doctors fuels concerns over healthcare appointments
item.description: A string of deaths has heightened fears that cancers and other illnesses are being missed because of the rise of phone and video consultations since the pandemic.

item.title: Lady Kitty, Amelia and Eliza Spencer look beautiful in black at London Fashion Week
item.description: Lady Kitty, Amelia and Eliza looked beautiful in black for the Perfect Magazine and NoMad London Fashion Week party on Sunday.

item.title: AMANDA HOLDEN turned 50 but that hasn't stopped her posting bikini shots
item.description: Amanda Holden, 50, says she won't apologise for living her life anymore and added she was 'delighted' with the 235 Britain's Got Talent complaints about her low-cut dress.

item.title: Jimmy Carr reveals how death of his beloved mum helped him to quit drinking
item.description: Ever met someone really fun, the life and soul of the party, a madman, a drinking machine? And then you find out he works in middle management for a large, grey oil company? That was me.

item.title: ALEX BRUMMER: It's time our leaders stopped being so naive on energy
item.description: ALEX BRUMMER: Both ordinary households and big energy users such as the steel industry face horrendous price increases which could trigger a catastrophic rise in inflation.

item.title: Confederation of British Industry warns staff shortages may stoke inflation
item.description: The CBI said 76 per cent of firms had reported access to staff as a threat to the UK's competitiveness, the highest proportion since the annual survey began 24 years ago.

item.title: Prince Andrew holds 'crisis talks' over sex case after 'disastrous' week trying to fight claims
item.description: Sources have suggested Prince Andrew is considering whether to continue instructing his current legal team as there is deep concern over how the Virginia Roberts lawsuit has been handled

item.title: Diamonds (and boosters) are Joan Collins's best friend
item.description: Looking glamorous in jewels and a straw cowboy hat, Dame Joan Collins receives her Covid booster in one arm - and her flu jab in the other. Millions will receive invitations for a third dose today.

item.title: French minister CANCELS meeting with defence secretary Ben Wallace
item.description: France's armed forces minister Florence Parly has cancelled a meeting with defence secretary Ben Wallace following the announcement of the UK' submarine deal with the US and Australia.

item.title: House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi tours Coronation Street set
item.description: Nancy Pelosi, the Speaker of the US House of Representatives, toured the exterior set and the Rovers Return at the ITV studios in Trafford, Greater Manchester.

item.title: Artipoppe: The celebrity-loved parenting buy that is flying off the shelves
item.description: A baby carrier that is popular with the likes of Emily Ratatjkowski, Jessica Alba and Gigi Hadid is proving to be the parenting buy of the year, with thousands flying off the shelves globally.

item.title: Prince Charles 'met fixer William Bortrick at centre of cash for honours storm NINE times'
item.description: William Bortrick, a paid advisor to tycoon Mahfouz Marei Mubarak bin Mahfouz - is said to have met the Prince in Britain and abroad on at least nine occasions, according to the Sunday Times.

item.title: DR MAX PEMBERTON: GPs who won't see patients are hurting the NHS
item.description: I've never been so naive as to think the NHS is perfect. Far from it. Of course it has its faults. But I always argued that it was an equitable and cheap way of delivering healthcare. Stock image

item.title: Shirley Ballas says you're never too old to find young love
item.description: Since 2017, she has been head judge on BBC's Strictly Come Dancing. She lives in London and has one son, Mark, 35. Twice divorced, her current partner is actor Danny Taylor, 48.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN pays tribute to England legend Jimmy Greaves following his death at 81
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: Jimmy Greaves' haul of 357 goals in 516 games has never been equalled in the top tier of English football. He was the youngest player to score 100 goals.

item.title: How I swapped the catwalk for horti-couture
item.description: I was one of the pioneers of the tulle skirt with heavy boots, as well as taking colour blocking. But since the pandemic my new favourite thing to dress is my little courtyard.

item.title: EMMA HOWARTH: How mystical adventures in every day helped my crippling anxiety
item.description: After a house move, Emma Howarth went off-kilter and fell into some bad habits so she decided to inject spiritual meaning into my everyday life.

item.title: KATIE GLASS reveals the reality of going through a 'dog divorce'
item.description: When Katie Glass ended her relationship with her fiancé during the first lockdown last year, after six years together, she knew there would be no going back. Now she's fighting for her labradoodle

item.title: Woman spots a 4ft long 'crocodile' on the loose in her neighbour's garden in Yorkshire
item.description: Sarah Jayne Ellis spotted the scaly creature, dubbed the 'Castleford Croc', in her neighbour's garden near the River Aire in West Yorkshire. said the creature appeared to be around four-foot-long.

item.title: Retired NHS worker suffered a 'slow' death after medics accidentally put a feeding tube in her lung
item.description: Maura Irwin, 77, from New Cross, southeast London, had the nasal feeding tube misplaced into her lung after suffering a stroke in February 2018, which then filled up and killed her, an inquest heard.

item.title: Vladimir Putin's party is set to retain majority in Russia's parliamentary elections, poll suggests
item.description: Polls from the Russian Far East suggested pro-Kremlin United Russia had between 40 and 45 per cent of the vote. But shocking videos were revealed allegedly showing illegal rigging.

item.title: French daredevil crosses Seine in Paris on tightrope 200ft above the ground from Eiffel Tower
item.description: French highliner Nathan Paulin, 27, left crowds gobsmacked as he walked 600 metres across a line stretched across the river between the Eiffel Tower and the Chaillot Theatre.

item.title: Three men killed and five others injured in horror crash on the M8 west of Glasgow
item.description: Police Scotland say a blue Audi came off the M8 motorway in the early hours of Sunday and three men were pronounced dead on scene while five men were taken to hospital with serious injuries

item.title: Ringleader of Insulate Britain's M25 eco mob 'lives in house with no cavity wall insulation'
item.description: Eco-warrior Liam Norton's south-west London home is single-glazed, has no cavity wall insulation and uses gas central heating, according to the Sun.

item.title: Six children are found living in 'Victorian slum' house as parents admit child cruelty charges
item.description: The stomach-churning pictures of the house in Wirral, Merseyside, showed mountains of rubbish piled up in the kitchen, the sink and bathtub filled with discarded cans.

item.title: Travel agent who scammed Cristiano Ronaldo out of £250,000 gets four-year suspended sentence
item.description: The 53-year-old, named in Portugal as Maria Silva, also scammed the football star's super-agent Jorge Mendes out of more than £14,000 and former Man U winger Nani out of more than £1,500.

item.title: 'Boosters are NOT the highest priority' Dr. Fauci says the main focus is still shots to unvaccinated
item.description: Fauci said that the priority in the U.S. is not 'getting boosters' approved, but making sure that those who still have not been vaccinated get the jab and approving jabs for kids under 12-years-old.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses star John Challis dies aged 79
item.description: Challis was best-known for his portrayal of second-hand car dealer Boycie in the beloved British sitcom Only Fools And Horses, starring alongside Sir David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

item.title: Man, 32, arrested on suspicion of murder as pensioner dies from head injuries in Wolverhampton
item.description: A 73-year-old man was taken to hospital with serious injuries after a 'domestic' incident in Wolverhampton and died this afternoon prompting police to launch a murder investigation.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing's 2021 launch show draws in LOWEST-EVER number of viewers
item.description: Strictly Come Dancing returned to screens for its 2021 run on Saturday evening - drawing in 7 million viewers and peaking at 7.3 million.

item.title: Joe and Jill take a bike ride as poll reveals voters think the country is less united under Biden
item.description: Joe and Jill Biden took a leisurely bike ride during their weekend in Rehoboth on Sunday as a new poll emerged showing more than half of Americans believe the country is less united under Biden.

item.title: Women working for Kabul government ordered to stay home by Taliban
item.description: The decision to prevent female city workers from returning to their jobs is another sign the Taliban are enforcing their harsh interpretation of Islam despite promises they had relaxed their stances.
item.media:description: Women march to demand their rights under the Taliban rule during a demonstration near the former Women's Affairs Ministry building in Kabul, Afghanistan, Sunday, Sept. 19, 2021. The interim mayor of Afghanistan's capital said Sunday that many female city employees have been ordered to stay home by the country's new Taliban rulers. (AP Photo)

item.title: Supermarkets are ALREADY selling festive products with shoppers urged to buy now and 'stock up'
item.description: Tesco, Sainsbury's, Marks and Spencer and Co-Op have already started putting out Christmas items on their shelves. It comes as today fears were raised of meat shortages due to a lack of CO2 gas.

item.title: Brazil striker Hulk, 35, announces his ex wife's niece, 32, is pregnant with his fourth child
item.description: The Brazilian football star, 35, dubbed Hulk for his upper-body strength, announced the news via an Instagram post alongside his ex-wife's niece and now wife Camila Sousa, 32.

item.title: New collection of unseen photographs of Elizabeth Taylor released
item.description: Eight photographers have contributed rare photos to a new book, Forever Elizabeth, including Gered Mankowitz who went to Sardinia to capture the star while she was on set for 1968 film Boom!

item.title: Changing Rooms reboot 'facing the AXE by Channel 4'
item.description: Changing Rooms is reportedly being axed by Channel 4, after just one rebooted series.

item.title: Uber boss admits cab-hailing service is suffering 'higher driver cancellations'
item.description: Jamie Heywood, Uber's general manager for northern and eastern Europe, has admitted that the app is suffering higher driver cancellations as drivers ditch jobs they don't think are 'worth it'.

item.title: Mother hanged herself hours after mental health crisis team failed to attend appointment, family say
item.description: Natasha Adams was discovered hanged at her flat in Solihull, on August 12. She had sought help from the mental health team at Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Birmingham the day before.

item.title: Girl, two, 'dies in front of her family after falling off pony at The Bedale Hunt'
item.description: The horrifying incident is said to have happened in front of the girl's family during The Bedale Hunt in Yorkshire on Wednesday. Police say a file is being prepared for the coroner.

item.title: Murder investigation is launched after man stabbed outside a railway station in south-east London
item.description: A murder investigation has been launched after a man, believed to be in his 40s, was stabbed outside Belvedere railway station in Bexley, south-east London, on September 18.

item.title: Covid infections rise by just 1.5% in a week
item.description: There were 29,612 new cases reported in the UK today - a 1.5 per cent increase from last Sunday's 29,173. The death figure stayed exactly the same - 56 for both today and last Sunday.

item.title: Back to reality! Emma Raducanu is spotted near her Bromley home
item.description: The Canadian-born 18-year-old from Kent was seen with her Romanian father Ian - with whom she rallied in the street during the Covid lockdown as she studied for her A-Levels - in the cul-de-sac earlier.

item.title: Elon Musk promises to donate $50 million to the Inspiration4 fundraiser for a children's hospital,
item.description: SpaceX founder and multibillionaire Elon Musk has promised to donate $50 million to SpaceX's Inspiration4 fundraiser for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

item.title: Manny Pacquiao will run for PRESIDENT of the Philippines in 2022 as great boxer accepts nomination
item.description: Manny Pacquiao has revealed he will run from president of the Philippines next year, less than a month after losing to Yordenis Ugas in the boxing ring.

item.title: Chris Rock reveals he has COVID-19: The comedian, 56, says 'trust me you don't want this'
item.description: The stand-up comedian who grew up in the Bedford-Stuyvesant of Brooklyn, New York took to social media to tells his fans 'trust me you don't want this.' He added, 'Get vaccinated.'

item.title: Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall join Boris Johnson and Priti Patel at Battle of Britain
item.description: Prince Charles, 72, donned his full military uniform while the Duchess of Cornwall, 74, wore a chic mid-length dress is shades of blue as they arrived at Westminster Abbey.

item.title: Hundreds strip off at sunrise for mass skinny dip in the North Sea
item.description: More than 800 men and women of all ages stripped down in Druridge Bay to enjoy a naked frolic in the North Sea.

item.title: Terrifying moment cyclist, 27, was sent flying into the air after being hit by a car
item.description: Jack Schofield, 27, escaped with his life after colliding with a car which appeared to cut straight across a mini roundabout in Ashby-de-la-Zouch, Leicestershire on Thursday.

item.title: Lib Dem leader Ed Davey insists party ''absolutely' believes in free speech amid trans rights row
item.description: Ahead of his party conference speech this afternoon the party leader was quizzed over the action taken against mother-of-two Natalie Bird earlier this year.

item.title: Armed Taliban fighters ride PEDALOS on lake in Afghanistan national park
item.description: Images appear to show militants riding swan-themed vessels on the water at Band-e Amir National Park - once a hotspot for international travellers and domestic tourists.

item.title: Adele goes Instagram official with her boyfriend Rich Paul
item.description: The singer, 33, took to the social media platform on Sunday and shared a loved-up snap of herself and the sports agent, 39, posing together in a photo booth.

item.title: Home with PERISCOPE from a World War Two Royal Navy submarine installed on sale for £2.5million
item.description: The aptly-named Periscope House in Old Portsmouth, Hampshire, which is currently owned by a retired local businessman, is on sale for £2.5million with estate agents Strutt and Parker.

item.title: Ministers 'increased risk of importing variants by abandoning testing system for global travel'
item.description: Ministers have increased the risk of importing dangerous new Covid variants to the UK by 'abandoning' the testing system for global travel, SAGE adviser Professor Stephen Reicher claimed.

item.title: Founder of Cricket boutique beloved by WAGS says the store 'was lucky to survive lockdown'
item.description: Justine Mills, owner of Cricket in Liverpool, told The Sunday Times the couture-selling store was lucky to survive the Covid-19 pandemic because it didn't have an online presence.

item.title: Boy, 16, arrested after girl, 6, lured away from playground in Birmingham and sexually assaulted
item.description: The girl was with her family when she was 'momentarily lured' into a nearby wooded area by a boy at Rowheath Park in Bournville, Birmingham at around midday on Saturday.

item.title: Woman in her 20s is dragged into churchyard and raped in Oxfordshire town
item.description: The victim, a woman in her twenties, was walking along Church Green, in Witney, Oxfordshire, just after 1.30am, when she was approached by a man she did not know.

item.title: Joe Biden will speak with French President Emmanuel Macron this week about canceled submarine deal
item.description: President Joe Biden will speak with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron this week regarding a diplomatic crisis triggered by Australia canceling its submarine purchase from Paris.

item.title: London council scraps SEVEN low traffic neighbourhoods after failing to improve air quality
item.description: Ealing Council in London studied nine LTNs following public outcry from local residents, who gathered in their thousands outside the town hall in April to demand they be axed.

item.title: Mystery as woman who speaks perfect English but can't remember her own name is found in Croatia
item.description: The woman was spotted by a fisherman while she was on jagged rocks on the isle of Krk, Croatia. She had suffered cuts to her face and told authorities she had no idea how she had got there.

item.title: Vets and owners are subjecting pets to painful treatments as they refuse to let them die
item.description: EthicsFirst, a group of veterinary professionals, said dogs and cats are able to receive complicated treatments, often covered by insurance, but cannot give their consent.

item.title: Tottenham and England legend Jimmy Greaves MBE passes away aged 81
item.description: Former Tottenham and Chelsea striker Jimmy Greaves MBE, known as one of the greatest goal scorers English football has ever produced, has died at the age of 81 after a period of illness.

item.title: Incredible pictures show how the years take their toll
item.description: Bored Panda has rounded up a selection of objects from around the world that been marked by time.

item.title: OB/GYN says he VIOLATED Texas law by performing abortion after six-week limit
item.description: Alan Braid, an OB/GYN physician, said he did the procedure while treating a woman at his San Antonio clinic on September 6 - five days after the restrictive new law known as SB8 went into effect.

item.title: Alok Sharma insists there is 'no immediate concern' about gas supplies amid meat shortage fears
item.description: The Cop26 president said ministers 'don't see any risks going into the winter' from a spike in global gas prices that prompted the closure of two industrial sites vital to the food and drink industry.

item.title: Mother pulled her daughter out of school because she wasn't learning enough about climate change
item.description: Clare Gregory, 39, from Wilmslow, Cheshire, feared Cora wasn't learning enough about protecting the planet in her local primary school and decided to carve her own path for her daughter.

item.title: Is there anything Gove can't do? Boris hands him control of beefed up department after reshuffle
item.description: His Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government is to be renamed the Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities, with a wider remit across the Government.

item.title: Fury as Green MP Caroline Lucas says M25 protest was 'reasonable'
item.description: During a fiery exchange on Sky News' Trevor Phillips on Sunday programme, the MP for Brighton Pavilion defended the 'extreme' actions of eco-zealots who blocked the M25 three times last week.

item.title: Woman's body found in Greenwich park near community centre as man arrested on suspicion of murder
item.description: The woman's body was found near a community centre in Greenwich, south-east London on Saturday. The Metropolitan Police said officers had been called to the scene at around 5.30pm.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand and Ian Wright lead tributes to England legend Jimmy Greaves who has died aged 81
item.description: Tributes have been paid to legendary Tottenham and England star Jimmy Greaves MBE who has died at the age of 81. Spurs announced the news on Sunday morning.

item.title: Thunderstorms are set to batter Britain today with 12 HOURS of downpours
item.description: Revellers hit the streets of Birmingham last night after a barmy Saturday as the Indian summer that Britain's been enjoying is replaced by thunderstorms today from Newcastle down to Brighton.

item.title: Collection of 650 coins, medals and paper money from Wiltshire to sell for £20,000 at auction
item.description: Over the course of 50 years, accountant David Ward, of Bulford, Wiltshire, collected almost 650 coins, tokens, medals and paper money. A penny from the reign of William I is set to fetch up to £700.

item.title: Jeremy Paxman reveals he kept falling on his face before being diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease
item.description: The author and University Challenge host, 71, told the Sunday Times Magazine that he knew something was wrong with him before his diagnosis because he kept falling over.

item.title: Stately home in Kent now luxe apartments and houses for sale
item.description: British Prime Minister William Pitt was among the 18th century guests at Wildernesse House in Sevenoaks. The house has now been transformed into a US-style retirement community.

item.title: Sex attacker, 23, who raped two men after meeting them on dating app Grindr is jailed for 14 years
item.description: Aaron Goodey, 23, met the men on the dating app before raping them in their homes. The court was told he forced his victims to withdraw cash while threatening them with further violence.

item.title: Iconic tower on former Redcar steelworks site is demolished
item.description: Images show the iconic 1950s Dorman Long Tower in Middlesbrough - a 183ft-high industrial landmark - being destroyed in a controlled explosion between midnight and 2am.

item.title: Mother reveals her baby son was born with a genetic condition so rare, it doesn't have a NAME yet
item.description: Lucinda Andrews, 32, from Chatham, Kent, revealed her son Leo, six months, was born with a genetic condition that affects the protein coding TBCD gene, which doesn't actually have a name.

item.title: Black Texas women filmed 'attacking NYC restaurant hostess' say they were racially profiled
item.description: Three Texas women who were seen in a video allegedly attacking a NYC restaurant hostess after their vaccination cards were questioned said they were racially profiled and called the n-word.

item.title: Tennis star Jelena Dokic, 38, hits back at body shamers after being cruelly taunted for her shape
item.description: Tennis champion Jelena Dokic has fired back at online trolls after she was taunted for her varying weights and sizes. The former World No.4 famously slimmed down to 67kg.

item.title: A birdwatcher, who's about to turn the sedate hobby into an EXTREME SPORT!
item.description: Sacha Dench, 41, is planning a 10 week trip in a motorised paraglider to follow a group of swans across 11 countries as they migrate.
